summary_variants.short_answer: Nairobi is the capital and largest city of Kenya, serving as East Africa's financial and diplomatic hub.
summary_variants.kid_friendly: Nairobi is Kenya's big city where the government works and where many people build things, do business, and visit nearby wildlife parks.
summary_variants.standard: Nairobi sits at 1,795 meters above sea level and hosts Kenyaâ€™s national government, multinational headquarters, and major UN offices. Its economy combines finance, technology, logistics, and tourism linked to Nairobi National Park.
summary_variants.expert_notes: Discuss rapid urbanization, transport corridors (SGR, BRT plans), and its role as headquarters for UNEP and UN-Habitat.
